what: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Author: Mark LondonLicense: MIT

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: staticanalysis provides suite tools auditing R project health, detecting logic duplication, automating refactoring legacy “monolith” scripts modern, testable packages. Unlike standard linters (check style), staticanalysis checks structure logic. uses robust Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) parsing ensure deterministic results, even file timestamps local environments vary.

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: package designed support “Strangler Fig” migration pattern: identifying legacy code, locking tests, extracting piece piece.

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Get high-level view project’s structure. tool flags: Test Coverage: functions lack corresponding unit tests. Misplaced Functions: Functions defined files match name (violating “One Function, One File” rule).
code: library(staticanalysis)  # Run a full inventory scan inv <- audit_inventory(".")  # View functions that need to be moved to their own files print(inv[inv$misplaced == TRUE, ])

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Identify “Copy-Paste” programming. function uses AST token analysis find structural clones. strictly typed, meaning distinguishes x + 1 x * 1, ignores variable names (foo vs bar) constants (optional).
code: # Find functions with identical logic signatures dupes <- detect_duplicates(".")  if (!is.null(dupes)) {   print(dupes) }

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Automatically clean “Roommate Functions” (multiple functions living single file). tool performs surgical extraction: Identifies misplaced functions. Extracts code Roxygen documentation (bottom-preserve line numbers). Moves R/<function_name>.R. Updates original file.
code: # Dry run to see what will happen refactor_misplaced(dry_run = TRUE)  # Execute the surgery refactor_misplaced(dry_run = FALSE)

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: primary tool breaking monolith scripts. extracts specific function legacy script generates corresponding “Red Light” test file.
code: # 1. Extract 'process_data' from 'old_script.R' # 2. Create 'R/process_data.R' # 3. Create 'tests/testthat/test-process_data.R' (Failing by default) scaffold_migration("process_data", source_file = "legacy/script.R")

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Find “Ghost Dependencies” (packages used code missing DESCRIPTION) unused imports.

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: Use visualize_progress() generate network graph showing decoupling project. Nodes represent functions, edges represent dependencies file membership.

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code
text: package uses custom geometry-based AST traversal engine (find_func_lines). ensures function boundaries correctly identified regardless nesting depth (e.g., functions wrapped tryCatch local), preventing common “parser mismatch” errors found regex-based tools.

title: Tools for Static Analysis of R Code

what: Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
title: Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
text: Scans specified project directory detect R packages actually used code (via library(), ::, Roxygen tags) compares DESCRIPTION file. helps identify: Ghosts: Packages used code missing DESCRIPTION. Unused: Packages declared DESCRIPTION never used code. Bloat: frequency table often package called.

title: Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
text: dir_path character string specifying path project root. Must contain R files optionally DESCRIPTION file.

title: Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
text: named list containing: usage_stats: data frame package usage counts. undeclared_ghosts: character vector packages used listed DESCRIPTION. unused_declarations: character vector packages listed DESCRIPTION found code.

title: Scan Project Dependencies (Robust AST Method) — scan_dependencies
code: # 1. Create a temporary "Fake Project" for testing tmp_proj <- tempfile("test_project") dir.create(tmp_proj)  # 2. Create a dummy DESCRIPTION file desc_content <- c(   "Package: TestProj",   "Imports: dplyr, fs" ) writeLines(desc_content, file.path(tmp_proj, "DESCRIPTION"))  # 3. Create a dummy R script script_content <- c(   "library(dplyr)",   "x <- tidyr::pivot_longer(mtcars)" ) writeLines(script_content, file.path(tmp_proj, "script.R"))  # 4. Run the scanner # (We wrap in if/try in case internal dependencies aren't loaded in this example context) if (requireNamespace("fs", quietly = TRUE)) {   try({     result <- scan_dependencies(tmp_proj)     print(result$undeclared_ghosts)   }) } #> [1] "tidyr"  # 5. Cleanup unlink(tmp_proj, recursive = TRUE)
